pr_title: Add support for different types under one field in a CRD

timeline.message:
Add support for different types under one field in a CRD

Signed-off-by: Jakub Scholz <www@scholzj.com>

Add some comments

Signed-off-by: Jakub Scholz <www@scholzj.com>

Add possibility to deprecate Type

Signed-off-by: Jakub Scholz <www@scholzj.com>

timeline.bodyText: What's the reasoning behind initializing with this size?
timeline.author: samuel-hawker

replies.bodyText: Honestly, it was in the old code. I just move it into separate method because of spotbugs. But I do not see any reason for it, so I changed it to 1.
replies.author: scholzj

timeline.message:
Fix default HashSet size

Signed-off-by: Jakub Scholz <www@scholzj.com>

timeline.bodyText: Any reason not to use java.lang.Class as the type?
timeline.author: tombentley

replies.bodyText:
The CrdGenerator and DocGenerator are based around properties. The way the annotation works to day is that the String specifies the name of the filed in the ThisOrThat class and that allows to easily integrate it -> basically just changes the parameter annotated as OneOfType with the two parameters from inside its class.
If you think having a class there would be cleaner despite the more complicated DocGenerator and CrdGenerator classes, I can change it.
replies.author: scholzj

replies.bodyText: AFAICS the string is only used in DocGenerator where it's immediately passed to Class.forName() to obtain a Class instance anyway. I don't understand what the drawback/complication is (I'm not saying there isn't one).
replies.author: tombentley

timeline.bodyText: ObjectMapper is thread-safe and relatively heavyweight. We should be moving in the direction of using a (few) constants, rather than instantiating every time we want to serialize or deserialize.
timeline.author: tombentley

replies.bodyText: I made the ObjectMapper static member of the deserializer class. Is that what you meant here?
replies.author: scholzj

timeline.message:
Use static ObjectMapper

Signed-off-by: Jakub Scholz <www@scholzj.com>

Replace @OneOfType with @Alternation and @Alternative (#4)

Signed-off-by: Tom Bentley <tbentley@redhat.com>

timeline.bodyText:
I'm not really sure I understand this. Each of the alternatives in the OneOfType can have a set of fields, but then the fields each get called alternatives?
Also, I think a more idiomatic thing to do would be to get a Property via Property.properties(property.getType().getType()). That way it will work correctly with getters and/or fields. It also keeps the reflection in Properties. Same comment goes for the DocGenerator, I think. Can we, at the same time, make the constructors of Property private?
timeline.author: tombentley
tombentley

timeline.bodyText:
What's the value of using Field, couldn't value just be a String[] of the field names.
Also, I think we should use the term property, rather than field, since in Java terms these things can be either fields or getters (aka properties).
timeline.author: tombentley
tombentley

replies.bodyText: Fixed. This seems to work and it will even work in the actual listeners use case. So this is good. Thanks.
replies.author: scholzj

timeline.message:
Improve the MapOrList deserializer

Signed-off-by: Jakub Scholz <www@scholzj.com>
